eu.stratosphere.nephele.io

Interface InputGate<T extends Record>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of record that can be transported through this gate
    All Superinterfaces:
    Gate<T>

    public interface InputGate<T extends Record>
extends Gate<T>
    In Nephele input gates are a specialization of general gates and connect input channels and record readers. As channels, input gates are always parameterized to a specific type of record which they can transport. In contrast to output gates input gates can be associated with a DistributionPattern object which dictates the concrete wiring between two groups of vertices.
    Author:
    warneke

    • Method Detail

      • readRecord

        T readRecord(T target)
      throws java.io.IOException,
             java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads a record from one of the associated input channels. The channels are chosen in a way so that channels with available records are preferred. The operation may block until at least one of the associated input channel is able to provide a record.
        Returns:
        the record read from one of the input channels or null if all channels are already closed.
        Throws:
        ExecutionFailureException - thrown if an error occurred while reading the channels
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • notifyRecordIsAvailable

        void notifyRecordIsAvailable(int channelIndex)
        Notify the gate that the channel with the given index has at least one record available.
        Parameters:
        channelIndex - the index of the channel which has at least one record available

      • notifyDataUnitConsumed

        void notifyDataUnitConsumed(int channelIndex)
        Notify the gate that is has consumed a data unit from the channel with the given index
        Parameters:
        channelIndex - the index of the channel from which a data unit has been consumed

      • initializeDecompressors

        void initializeDecompressors()
                      throws CompressionException
        Initializes the decompressor objects inside the input channels attached to this gate.
        Throws:
        CompressionException - thrown if an error occurs while loading the decompressor objects

      • activateInputChannels

        void activateInputChannels()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.InterruptedException
        Activates all of the task's input channels.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if an I/O error occurs while transmitting one of the activation requests to the corresponding output channels
        java.lang.InterruptedException - throws if the task is interrupted while waiting for the activation process to complete

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.io.IOException,
           java.lang.InterruptedException
        Immediately closes the input gate and all its input channels. The corresponding output channels are notified. Any remaining records in any buffers or queue is considered irrelevant and is discarded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if an I/O error occurs while closing the gate
        java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown if the thread is interrupted while waiting for the gate to be closed

      • createNetworkInputChannel

        void createNetworkInputChannel(InputGate<T> inputGate,
                               ChannelID channelID,
                               ChannelID connectedChannelID,
                               CompressionLevel compressionLevel)
        Creates a new network input channel and assigns it to the given input gate.
        Parameters:
        inputGate - the input gate the channel shall be assigned to
        channelID - the ID of the channel
        connectedChannelID - the ID of the channel this channel is connected to
        compressionLevel - the level of compression to be used for this channel

                    throws java.io.IOException,

        Checks if the input gate has records available.
